issues.description: The problem statement (Part 2, Controller description) repeatedly refers to the callback parameter type as Consumer<List<Note>> when describing the PersonController methods, but both the template and the solution declare and expect Consumer<List<Person>>. This type mismatch in the narrative (Note vs Person) is a wording/parameter-type inconsistency that may confuse students about the expected generic type for the consumers they must implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Fix the problem statement text to reference Consumer<List<Person>> (not Consumer<List<Note>>) when describing the callback parameter for the PersonController methods. This aligns the documentation with the template method signatures and the solution implementation and avoids confusion for students.
